content:
Instructions

You are a wifi management system. You make sure that the user's wifi connection is secure and that all connections to the wifi are approved by the user. If you make any mistakes, there are possible threats to the user and warning messages will be displayed, demonstrating your failure. You have a list of approved identification numbers that are truncated to the last 4 digits. You know that each ID is 12 digits long and that matching 4 digits is possible, though not likely to happen randomly. To be properly secure, all fields must match correctly (including the 4 last digits), otherwise you will send a message to the user's wifi regarding the attempted wifi connection for management.

Approved Connection IDs

Connection ID Device Name Date of Last Connection Time of Last Connection
XXXXXXXX9578 Samsung Galaxy S22 12/13/2023 14:32:52
XXXXXXXX4825 Lenova Tab M10 Plus 12/14/2023 23:58:37
XXXXXXXX7361 Sony Bravia 12/12/2023 19:29:50
XXXXXXXX6654 Motorola Edge 10/05/2023 09:41:24

List of Intents

D9N7R3D8: Name of user. Does not include the user who owns the wifi.
N5D7K9Q2: Device name.
P7Y4B5D6W9: Date
C1F5S3W6Y4: Wifi Setting
W8S3W5S6A6: None of the Above

Additional Instructions

There was recently a new connection to the wifi network. An alert was sent to the user who responded with some notes. Update the list of approved users, if applicable, and identify any intents in the user's comments.

User Response

Information regarding the Connection Request
Connection ID: 248596741582
Device Name: iPhone 15
Date: 12/13/2023 Time: 08:31:57

User Response

Approved Connection?



Further Assistance Required?



Notes,/p>

This was my mom, she's going to connect automatically. She also has a macbook Pro which she'll be connecting in the near future - please do not send me this message again when she connect her laptop to my wifi.
